intro: Scaphochlamys samunsamensis, commonly known as the Samunsam mountain orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, elongated floral structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often on rocky substrates or in forest understories. Its flowers are usually small, with intricate patterns and vibrant colors, adapted for specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a critically endangered species.
